where I = moment of inertia of the disc about the axis of suspension in lbs. 

r = length of wire in feet, d = diameter of wire in inches.

An annular ring is generated by the revolution of a circle of radius a about a radius distant k from the centre of the circle. Find the moment of inertia of the ring about this axis. (Hint: Compute the polar moment I_p, i.e., the moments about the given axis of an annulus made by a section at right angles to this axis, finding an expression for the inner and outer radii of the annulus, in terms of the distance from the central annulus, and then sum up.)

blocks.description: This equation represents the moment of inertia of an annulus.
